fields.name: user
fields.description: List of registered users, must be admin to call

fields.name: myUser
fields.description: Information about the currently logged in user

fields.name: myAlbums
fields.description: List of albums owned by the logged in user.

args.name: onlyRoot
args.description: Return only albums from the root directory of the user

args.name: showEmpty
args.description: Return also albums with no media directly in them

fields.name: album
fields.description:
Get album by id, user must own the album or be admin
If valid tokenCredentials are provided, the album may be retrived without further authentication

fields.name: myMedia
fields.description: List of media owned by the logged in user

fields.name: media
fields.description:
Get media by id, user must own the media or be admin.
If valid tokenCredentials are provided, the media may be retrived without further authentication

fields.name: mediaList
fields.description: Get a list of media by their ids, user must own the media or be admin

fields.name: myTimeline
fields.description: Get a list of media, ordered first by day, then by album if multiple media was found for the same day.

args.name: fromDate
args.description: Only fetch media that is older than this date

fields.name: myMediaGeoJson
fields.description: Get media owned by the logged in user, returned in GeoJson format

fields.name: mapboxToken
fields.description: Get the mapbox api token, returns null if mapbox is not enabled

fields.name: initialSetup
fields.description: Whether or not the initial setup wizard should be shown

fields.name: faceDetectionEnabled
fields.description: Whether or not face detection is enabled and working

fields.name: periodicScanInterval
fields.description: How often automatic scans should be initiated in seconds

fields.name: concurrentWorkers
fields.description: How many max concurrent scanner jobs that should run at once

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: albums
fields.description: All albums owned by this user

fields.name: rootAlbums
fields.description: Top level albums owned by this user

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: media
fields.description: The media inside this album

fields.name: subAlbums
fields.description: The albums contained in this album

fields.name: parentAlbum
fields.description: The album which contains this album

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who owns this album

fields.name: filePath
fields.description: The path on the filesystem of the server, where this album is located

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: An image in this album used for previewing this album

fields.name: path
fields.description: Local filepath for the media

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: URL to display the media in a smaller resolution

fields.name: highRes
fields.description: URL to display the photo in full resolution, will be null for videos

fields.name: videoWeb
fields.description: URL to get the video in a web format that can be played in the browser, will be null for photos

fields.name: album
fields.description: The album that holds the media

fields.name: date
fields.description: The date the image was shot or the date it was imported as a fallback

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL for previewing the image

fields.name: width
fields.description: Width of the image in pixels

fields.name: height
fields.description: Height of the image in pixels

fields.name: fileSize
fields.description: The file size of the resource in bytes

fields.name: camera
fields.description: The model name of the camera

fields.name: maker
fields.description: The maker of the camera

fields.name: lens
fields.description: The name of the lens

fields.name: exposure
fields.description: The exposure time of the image

fields.name: aperture
fields.description: The aperature stops of the image

fields.name: iso
fields.description: The ISO setting of the image

fields.name: focalLength
fields.description: The focal length of the lens, when the image was taken

fields.name: flash
fields.description: A formatted description of the flash settings, when the image was taken

fields.name: exposureProgram
fields.description: An index describing the mode for adjusting the exposure of the image

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ShareToken
types.description: A token used to publicly access an album or media

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who created the token

fields.name: expire
fields.description: Optional expire date

fields.name: hasPassword
fields.description: Whether or not a password is needed to access the share

fields.name: album
fields.description: The album this token shares

fields.name: media
fields.description: The media this token shares

types.name: ShareTokenCredentials
types.description: Credentials used to identify and authenticate a share token

fields.name: initialSetupWizard
fields.description: Registers the initial user, can only be called if initialSetup from SiteInfo is true

fields.name: scanAll
fields.description: Scan all users for new media

fields.name: scanUser
fields.description: Scan a single user for new media

fields.name: shareAlbum
fields.description: Generate share token for album

fields.name: shareMedia
fields.description: Generate share token for media

fields.name: deleteShareToken
fields.description: Delete a share token by it's token value

fields.name: protectShareToken
fields.description: Set a password for a token, if null is passed for the password argument, the password will be cleared

fields.name: favoriteMedia
fields.description: Mark or unmark a media as being a favorite

fields.name: userAddRootPath
fields.description: Add a root path from where to look for media for the given user

fields.name: setPeriodicScanInterval
fields.description:
Set how often, in seconds, the server should automatically scan for new media,
a value of 0 will disable periodic scans

fields.name: setScannerConcurrentWorkers
fields.description: Set max number of concurrent scanner jobs running at once

fields.name: resetAlbumCover
fields.description: Reset the assigned cover photo for an album

fields.name: setAlbumCover
fields.description: Assign a cover photo to an album

fields.name: setFaceGroupLabel
fields.description: Assign a label to a face group, set label to null to remove the current one

fields.name: combineFaceGroups
fields.description: Merge two face groups into a single one, all ImageFaces from source will be moved to destination

fields.name: moveImageFaces
fields.description: Move a list of ImageFaces to another face group

fields.name: recognizeUnlabeledFaces
fields.description: Check all unlabeled faces to see if they match a labeled FaceGroup, and move them if they match

fields.name: detachImageFaces
fields.description: Move a list of ImageFaces to a new face group

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Time in milliseconds before the notification will close

enumValues.name: Close
enumValues.description: Close a notification with a given key

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: The @deprecated directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL services schema, such as deprecated fields on a type or deprecated enum values.
